page.title: 09THE FISH KEEPER
page.content: { The Fish Keeper} The Test River, famous for its trout and pure water, rises just outside Overton and runs through the village. Conservation of the fish is the job of a fish keeper (water bailiff). One of these is Mr. Wolford. He cares for a stretch of water five and a half miles long and two and a half feet deep. He works in any weather, in the summer from light until dark and at other times from seven o'clock until four. He and his wife also run a fish farm with about a thousand fully grown fish. Mrs. Wolford looks after four thousand fish eggs at a time. Green dyed fungicide is put into the river to prevent fungi growing on the fish. The water level is controlled by sluices.
